b8pAVqs6MTtgbmPNdiCM-g.text: Fatburger provides a solid quick-service style burger open 24 hours on the Strip right across the street from the Monte Carlo.   When I went there you could choose from small through XXXL for the burger size. I heard from a friend that their used to be only 3 sizes. I think that kind of simplicity would have be nice since I was quite baffled about which size to order. The burgers are all cooked to order which is nice but may cause a little bit of a wait. Cheese, chili, bacon, and egg are all chargable upgrades for the burger while other condiments are available for no additional charge.   I was talked into the medium size burger. I added cheese, bacon, and a fried egg. It was too big. I got to the awkward point in my meal where I was satisfied to be done eating but only had a little bit of burger to go. I decided to avoid feeling the gut bomb and just tossed it. Along with my burger I ordered the skinny fries which turned out were not really all that skinny. I mean, they were pretty much standard size fries. I think I would have been better off if I topped them with chili or ordered the fat fries or onion rings instead. Lesson learned.  All in all, it is a decent option for late night eats. Especially if you want to avoid the more notorious fast food burgers, and of course, you have at least $10 to burn on a quick bite.

_eP0aQ8tt38_qrpfL-ydSA.text: It took 30min to get my damn burger!!!  And when i got it, the burger was cold and the bun was hard and stale. WTF??!!!

xHfShCyuMUl7E44BaldGQA.text: This place is great.  Open 24 hours,  they welcome all sorts of fun ppl just looking to have a good time and don't want the party/good times to stop while grabbing a bite.  The staff here are fun and hilarious, from cashier, to ppl serving food, to ppl calling out orders.  Had a laugh w/the cashier, the lady calling out the orders wouldn't let me have my food unless  I yelled my order out or yelled where I was from, lol.  Lucky I had all my friends w/me to give a shout out to OC, represent!  Customers made the wait fun!   The wait's kinda long, but like I said the staff and customers make it fun.  Thumbs up for ppl who love what they do!

R9Lo1IIi8gZpQLMmEWMs4w.text: Fat burger has gone Hollywood! I never thought that I would see the day that the restaurant would look better than the burger. $7 for a 1/3lb burger that looks more like a slider. I'm good of the Vegas Fatburger. I hope the one on Crenshaw didn't change up on the original Fatburger patrons!

Bh0Up8FwI7gEsZDYKokuow.text: My BF loved it and thought it was amazing... He had a big beef burger with everything on it super juicy he thought. I had the turkey burger, I was not impressed, it was just maybe ok. Good service at a fair price for the area.

olcl3teNHChy0hSehXNrqg.text: "Brunched" at FatBurger after a late start to the day (who the hell is waking up early in Vegas anyway?!).  FATBURGER!!!  YUMMMMMYYYY!!!!  I remember ordering and the cashier suggesting I go all the way after I mentioned that I didn't want relish on my burger.  Thank you, Mr. Cashier!  The flavors on this "fast-food" burger go together like crazy!  The burgers are grilled to order and all of the toppings are fresh - probably because nothing gets a chance to sit around here.  The joint is jumping, we could barely find seats!  But back to the burger.  Just so fresh....and tasty......and not fast-foody, unsure of the meat species at all!  Fatburger is definitely all beef all the time.  And PLEASE don't get me started on the skinny chili cheese fries.  OMGeee!!!  I'm about to go on record as saying they were the best I've ever had...  At least definitely in recent memory.  Deliciously tart lemonade too.  Mmmm!!!  Dernit, now I've gotta make my way down to the one on South Beach.  Excuse me for a moment...

QziQsmX-n6tR6N_lf5Essg.text: I wanted to eat a burger here since there isn't one where I live. Kinda pricey $17 for a burger drink and fries. The food was alright. I've tasted a better burger, fries including a drink at a little food stand in the downtown area where I work, for only $6

zUbnIS7ITT7KIDvIJXAS3Q.text: Very slow service (was in a line of 5 people and it took over 15 minutes at the slushee bar). Little if any alcohol in the slushee.

SGcG6KciCrr4VXJKMODy9g.text: We were tired and walking around aimlessly after one of our tours and stopped in for burgers. They are pretty good and not overly expensive.

5_-aymht3aSC3RjaoUmtdw.text: Demolished their XXX Challenge after a full day of eating... lol But, despite it being a challenge, the burger was delicious! Not much else to say about that because there wasn't really any special things that any other burger joint doesn't already do, but they are open 24hrs!!!! Huge Plus!!!! Definitely will return to conquer another XXX (just because I can)... Btw, they employ a lot of Polynesians, Much Mahalos for that! Feels good to see my own peeps around, and working!!!

EW-Yk6tPYhM5tImodZCJAw.text: This place is expensive as hell! But it is Vegas and on the strip so technically this should be considered as "average" price. Came here at 1:30am Sunday morning and ate outside on the patio area. Music was playing, nice cool breeze outside, so I say this was a perfect night to eat outside. When we got our food, the burgers were fresh and hot and freaken good! I would say this cannot beat in n out but it does come in 2nd in my book!

UHdrGhFXXnQsMmE4HU5vFg.text: Our server Mallory was super awesome!! Very attentive and a great personality. She made our stay worthwhile.

7uWnfDW5wIMA3lV729-Nxg.text: This place is definitely not as great as everyone makes it seem. I would choose In and Out Burger ANYDAY. The burgers are extremely small for their price. It was almost $5 for a small burger that was the size of a microwavable burger you would get at AMPM. I was soooo disappointed when my guy friends ordered and ate the entire thing in about 3 bites. I had ordered the medium sized meal for a little over $10 and that included a burger twice the size as the small (yet about the same size of a regular in and out burger), steak fries and a medium drink. This was by far the most expensive fast food that I have ever purchased and tasted like I could get it at my neighbor's BBQ next week. They did not have any special sauces so I was bewildered to see how this was considered a top place to go to late at night. Particularly because there is a McDonald's next door and dollar menu was looking mighty fine after this disheartening meal. If you wanna save some money as well as have a good meal, I'd suggest you walk 10 feet away to the Mcdonald's next door and have a feast.

jyj4npD8LIgF2wpuXaNOMw.text: GROOOOSSSSS!!!! IDK how do people actually enjoy their burgers :X *Barf The only reason why I THINK people go here is because their open 24 hours serving disgusting burgers... Roaming around the strip drunk in the am anything sounds/taste delicious right?! WRONG!!!!   By the time it was 6am in Vegas i was seriously craving for a mchicken across the street after EDC but little did my idiotic brain knew that mcd was serving breakfast :(( booo! so we opted to go to fatburger since we were all craving for "burgers" We waited in line looking at their menu and decided to go w/ their medium burger.   The employee who took my order not only was falling asleeep on me, she asked me for my order 3x's and not only was she confused I WAS CONFUSED!! i was not frustrated at all although i was drunk ordering my food, i felt bad cause she told me she was working a long shift and she couldn't wait to go home...   When i got my order i asked for ketchup and she told me they didn't have any?! what the f****** what kind of burger joint doesn't have any ketchup?! s0o i asked another employee and he actually gave me some.. lol   When we got back into our hotel i opened my burger with excitement ready to devour that sh*t and the burger was cold and soft... disgusting and it tasted to PLAIN. i opened my bun and there WAS NO KETCHUP OR ANYTHING..... Was i suppose to order a burger w/ ketchup?! i thought it usually comes w/ condiments w/o being said?!   You don't go to mcd and burger king ordering a burger and say "Oh don't foget the ketchup, pickles, mustard, and onions" -___-

eC-2QutvSStJIQGmDaT3zw.text: This place is sooo good! Don't order a baby fat burger if you want a burger smaller than a McDonald's burger.. yikes.. Their onion rings are delish too! Not too greasy.

_lfJGOU138RsiQselid-Fg.text: Great late night food and great bar to keep on partying, fries are good.  Can't beat being right off the strip especially when everything else is closed.

d_yzwvmN2p4_6ahOIbOCGg.text: Great late night fast place to eat. People usually go there for the burgers, but the hot dogs are surprisingly good! Give them a try!!

gNmg0p3qnSrKQT6YJCW11w.text: We went here late at night because most of the food inside the food court at the MGM was closed. It was a short walk from the MGM. Outside the have a Fat Bar. We went inside and there was no wait. This Fatburger doesn't have kids meals. We ordered the smallest burgers, fat fries, and skinny fries. We also got root beer floats. They give you a cup with ice cream and you can put any kind of soda into it. My kids were happy. You can also get refills on the soda part of the float. Our burgers seemed small and less tasty than most Fatburgers and the bun wasn't super fresh. They also don't have stamp cards but were willing to stamp mine that I had.

A2ryPbV9nbM-fOFksbO2MA.text: I came here for a quick afternoon bite during my Vegas rendezvous this past weekend. A Fatburger with an outside bar???!!! I was hooked immediately! The ambience there was quite loud, considering there was a football game on. The TV's that they had outside made the place look like a very chill atmosphere. I grabbed a grilled chicken burger with skinny fries and I must say, it did not disappoint. I'm from L.A. and I try to eat here as much as I can! Yeah, it was more than I usually pay for that meal($11.85 to be exact!!) but hey, im not complaining. Its Vegas folks! Expect to spend a little while here. I will definitely come back next time I hit up the Strip.

C8lG2s9GMEQxhbQzN1dE8w.text: Worst Fatburger ever.  Honestly, it took about 30 mins to get 2 milkshakes.  A lot of the customers in the restaurant seemed unhappy with their service.  I get that it was 1am at night, but it took over 3 mins for me to pay with a credit card.  I love the Fatburger franchise, but this location does it shame.

y_fgyYBVzMWnjNbpAzjL5g.text: Ahh Fatburger, how do I love thee?? Lucky for me, I was born on the west coast and have always had access to In--out and Fatburger. The raging debate goes on as to which is better. Well duh, they are different!! They both have fantastic things to offer. Fatburger is fantastic, because a. they cook your food when you order it, b. you can get a fried egg on top of your burger, and c. you can fax in your order. Fatburger tastes so great and you get your choice of skinny fries, fat fries, or onion rings. Also, you can get a turkey burger which is so good!! I crave Fatburger once in a while and I absolutely cannot satisfy the craving otherwise.

I1VaeSaTxgY8zZTdBgvpGQ.text: a transcendent burger experience. so greasy, so much, so wonderful.  the perfect (preventative) cure for a hangover.

1NSMdHn7eADQtr5AR4C50A.text: It's the best burger in Vegas but I say that because it's the only burger I have and ever will eat in Vegas (I am from Chicago). Last summer I was visiting and I made my friends walk from the Belaggio to Fatburger listening to them whine and complain about the distance the whole way. To me its no big deal to walk that far...its not even that far. But after we ate they agreed it was worth it. I wish I knew what spcies they use in the burgers....

q3HiuGV4MJL7DkXzwcOafA.text: If you're looking for a cheap place to eat that's not the typical fast food joint you'd find across the nation, eat here!!! The burgers are actually quite tasty. I ordered (my very first) fatburger, with cheese and egg. The burger was well flavored and juicy, a good amount of pickles and mustard to finish off the hamburger. I think I only tasted one bite of onion though. If it weren't for In-N-Out, I'd say this place definitely outranks any franchised burger joint. But, a True fan stays loyal. In-N-Out forever. However, Ice Cube, I do know what you mean. I too, would want a fatburger 2 in the morning...only in Vegas.

M292ZevNyFDunSzgN3DEyQ.text: Good burgers. Juicy, nice size, well cooked. Not the best, but a good, solid burger nonetheless. Just remember when you ask for everything on it, that means EVERYTHING... including relish, which I can't say I've ever had on a burger before. It is a bit on the pricey side for fast food, but hey - it's Vegas. Part of the reason it gets bumped up to a four is because of the atmosphere. The jukebox plays pretty good hip-hop/R&B and workers are friendly. Be wary of the bathrooms though... Not the cleanest.... Just a heads-up.

-98XIe-YkNbmHge3NaNUpA.text: oh Fatburger, how i missed thee.  how long has it been since i last pay you a visit?  ahh that's right, it was back when i was dating this chick who gives me a guilt trip for not being religious.  i guess that's why she is history and Fatburger isn't.  succulent burgers, golden brown fries, cavity-forming root beer float..., need i say more?  i could hardly contain myself when i was in line and almost plowed into the people in front of me.  ya so i was hungry, forgive me (i'm being religious here).  i broke down and ordered me a chili-cheese fries, a cheese burger, and washed it down with a big-ass root beer float (sinful).  i can't say that  i'll stay afloat after having all that food (i'm going down straight to hell)..., but i sure felt an orgasmic (heavenly) experience.  so next time you spot a Fatburger, go in and have yourself a religious experience.  i'm sure my ex would have been proud of me!

SyOUHQLHffwCTZMtj91s0g.text: Great price and value for their food. Their burgers are tasty and you can customize them any way you want. Their chili-cheese fries are awesome as well. Are open all night which is a good bonus. Friendly staff as well. Would recommend to anyone looking to crash a food stop on the strip.

ZxKVyaiiLlkM0ktagOVsSg.text: I was really impressed with their Boca burger.  It's not every fast food hamburger joint that has a veggieburger.  I was really glad it was well done because I ordered everything on the burger.  It seemed like this place was always open; people were constantly lined up to try the Fatburger.

ow6OtWQ9KFGHGy8h5NqXfQ.text: Yeah its a 5.00 for the "fatburger," which wasn't that large- but it was good and the quality and flavor beats MCDONALDS next door. Although I find that the people who go here are ...well interesting is a nice way to put it.

8RdruUsbgpcp9bzBk7UpcQ.text: We stopped by here after going to the after hours club, Empire. It was around 4:00am-5:00am, we were drunk and hungry so we ate here. Like what everyone else said, is this place ever clean? My friends and I came back here three times during the week (usually in the late night, early morning) and it was always dirty. They have tons of ingredients on the burger: mustard, relish, onions, pickles, tomato, lettuce, mayo, and cheese, bacon, egg, chili (which cost extra). Ate at this place in Vegas and SoCal and came to realize, I'm not a huge fan of it and only eat it due to its convenience and because we didn't know where else to eat in Vegas during that time. Onion rings and steak fries were mediocre. Could barely finish a king burger to myself, fat burger was pretty easy to kill by myself. Also, at the bottom of your receipt, they usually offer free onion rings for your next burger purchase...keep in mind, the onion rings aren't that great.

LeZxxVrrKsTVbc5b4U7Fpw.text: I personally enjoyed In and Out much more than Fatburger. Fatburger is your more greasy, down to earth, bar food type of burger. Nothing too special about it, although they do offer ginormous portions, and give you an option to add a fried egg.  I was not very fond of the wedge fries, got to sample the shoe strings and onion rings, both which taste better. The location is great if you are staying around the strip, about a 5 min walk from planet hollywood.

CP2ai_0hekpCLSSLhXYNag.text: I've been to Fatburger twice.  My first experience was no good.  My husband made me get the XL (with two patties, i think) and I wanted to throw up.  I was pregnant and the look of it made me sick.  BUT...I went to Fatburger again last weekend and it was really good!  It really hit the spot after a day of shopping with the girls.  I'm a burger and fries kinda girl!  Skinney fries were delish!

UFS99aEYb2nRTABpz1rCqg.text: What better way to satiate your drunken munchies in Vegas than to go to Fatburger.  I had the King burger with egg.  To tell you the truth I was too faded to even remember how it tasted.  2 important things:  1) I was able to eat it, 2) I didn't puke.  I'd say that's a good sign that It's at least worth three stars.

-YFoHJzGmGX-FaeWK8MyEA.text: This joint is kind of ghetto, especially if you're just coming from a fancy casino, but the burgers are da bomb.  freshly made, so juicy.  Get your burger with the fried egg -- you won't regret it.  And get the "fat" fries.  Free refrills on sodas too.

nqGHE8affXDv5S_ZouxR_g.text: I went to Fat Burger on the strip a week ago. I ordered the xxx cheese burger to go. I got home 20 min later then and started to eat the burger and no more than 3 bit in i immediately started vomiting. my friend examined the meat and it was spoiled with what looked like fat shit.   I was violently ill over the next few days. I had bloody stool, abdominal pain, vomiting for 2 days. I would not recommend to EAT at FAT Burger unless you have a death wish. I have 3 witnesses that can affirm to this and a video that i am about to post on you tube. DON'T EAT AT FAT BURGER UNLESS YOU HAVE A DEATH WISH!!!!!!!

LSZ4WQ1P3ZE4cUTJn0e3Bw.text: Came here at 1 A.M. with my little brother, it's been a while since i'd been to a fat burger. I've been eating so much in n out i forgot what a fat burger taste like, so i got a large with everything in it including an egg! It was pretty darn good, the first thing i noticed about a fat burger thats different than a lot of the burgers that i've had is that a lot of the focus on flavor actually goes into the meat. Instead of everything that surrounds it. All in all a pretty good burger and a good A.M. snack!

Nw4HyB9kBNQW5sf8G3zkXA.text: Open 24 hours does not make this place good.  We stumbled in here as the sun was rising for a nice burger and a breakfast sandwich, and I have never been so disappointed by a place in my life.  The food took forever, with about only 3-4 people ahead of us.  Also while waiting we witnessed a fight between two guys waiting in line, rolling on the ground with light slapping back and forth.  Then I made the mistake of going to the bathroom.  I have never, ever seen a bathroom as bad as this one.  The Caution Wet Floor sign was up, implying that they mopped, but that bathroom has not seen a mop or cleaning materials in a long time and smelled horrible.  Our food eventually came out and was really mediocre, between all of us there, most said they wished we went to McDonalds instead and the rest said they wished they had not ordered anything at all.  I would never go back.

MxlFeKxeUqqyOmPHYdomug.text: A great place to grab a quick bite of food, especially late at night. I think they're 24 hours... The atmosphere is boisterous with the workers singing along with their fancy jukebox, bumpin at club volumes. I wouldn't recommend eating inside unless you like that kind of thing. Anyway, even though this place looks kind of fishy, their burgers actually tasted fresh. They make it right when you order it; so, it's nice and hot. It kind of reminded me of In-N-Out.

yKCeuhu_2ZERTloQf_hFWQ.text: Chedder Bacon cheeseburger, Wow. Open 24 hours!  Made to order.  Great burger joint

l5Xh91daw4t8LV2GCvfUlA.text: It's about 3 a.m.-- you and your party is super-drunk from a night at Pure at Caesar's Palace-- where do you go? FATTBURGER- the last great hamburger stand! For me, all it takes is a turkey burger with the works, fries, and a chocolate milkshake to revive the evening's memories. Open 24 Hours. Thank you Vegas.

f-hys3187zmE0ZB2tNlh4g.text: We have a split house on this one.  Husband loves this place since we had one locally.  He loves the burgers and fries.  I thought it was ok, nothing to write home about....just another burger place.

0LrGfuALJJtMdxcNfJC0Zg.text: A good burger spot that's open 24hrs is definateLy convenient for any burger Lover! 5am after a night in the cLub, FatBurger is the pLace to be!

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/4 pound FatBurger.. FatBurgers and FatBeats!  Free fries when you get a beer.. ExceLLent!

gYJOTv50xRwbOkBedTlKzw.text: Oh lite night fix. How I love you fatburger, you are always reliable when others are closed. You provide greasy food to prevent my hangover from overtaking me in the morning. Thank goodness they have a veggie burger. Life saver. It's not my favorite veggie burger, that's why they only get 4 stars. But it does take care of the late night drunken cravings. :)

YrXFNsu2B6wDhIiS3qNYiA.text: Conveniently located on the strip, Fat Burger makes for a convenient hangover cure. I have absolutely zero complaints about this place. For someone who just recently started eating burgers again I have no regrets. I thought this place was so good that I came here twice and wanted to go again before my flight home but overslept lol. It was one of the best burgers I've had honestly. The burger was seasoned to perfection and with all the toppings it was a mess of flavorful and deliciousness.

I'm curious how would I feel after eating their XXXL Burger, but the one I ate was very tasty and big, plus the onion rings were awesome. Big recommendation for Fat burger!

W0T4jXDKGWlPdopbAzn5DQ.text: The food is ok, good, nothing out of the extraordinary! If you've never been there I do recommend you go at lest once, it's one of those type of restaurants. I sat out side in the FATBAR, but I wasn't ordering alcoholic beverages so the lazy waitress said to go order inside cause the out door sitting area of the restaurant is a whole different owner or some non-sense like that.

_emuJeTzWdCEVXmIcZsW2Q.text: I'm being generous with two stars that's just because they are opened late. When we got here it was packed! I ordered the XXl Burger and I asked the lady what's the best fries because they have different choices she told me the chili cheese fries. I asked her let me get those without chili and just make them cheese fries.. When I saw those fries after I ordered them I was very disappointed it was like they took American cheese and put it on top and let it melt. I was very confused on how you mess up cheese fries it's very easy. Anyways the burger was big but tasted like nothing if that makes any sense. The bun was like dry and not soft it was gross I needed a lot of coke to wash it down with. After I eat it my stomach wasn't happy for a while. This place is over priced and gross. I'd rather find another burger place that actually cares about your food.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese fries were disgusting!! Burger was terrible!!

YSdduY9wBR62HYQneEPeDw.text: Aye, if you're looking for a good burger with authentic topics and flavor right on the strip, this is your spot. Legitimate burger. A medium will fill you up just fine and it's pretty expensive to add to it aside from the basics. But totally worth it if you do! I got a medium with chili and cheese. Real chili and not some weird Texas Pete out the can type ish. This is good stuff. Stop by for a quick bite!

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cPQ08cQwI3eLkEIQ6HQP2A.text: We decided to go to Fatburger for lunch, since this is considered a popular location on the Vegas Strip. I had the Turkey Burger with guacamole and my husband and I split an order of fries (my husband had a regular bacon cheeseburger with a fried egg). Thirty-plus dollars later, I have to say I was a little disappointed. With all the hype, I expected something greater. The food wasn't spectacular; the food wasn't bad. It was just woefully average. It's definitely not somewhere I would visit more than once.

khmUM3BNhBrd9bJk0l-MLQ.text: Labor Day Week 2016: I experienced a Fat Burger and it was very tasty!! The meat is cooked well done if that's what you prefer yet, not over cooked, well seasoned! Perfect for after partying...

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Burger no cheese

QwIWONAuBzslZFCfIGfJ9w.text: I can't vouch for their tagline of "The Last Great Hamburger Stand," though I like to visit several restaurants in a franchise before making an overall judgment. This particular Fatburger did not make a great first impression on me. I did enjoy the casual atmosphere and the outdoor dining, albeit really loud. At places like these, I like to order my burger with basic toppings like lettuce and tomato and no sauces or cheese so I can see how the burger itself tastes. Mine was overcooked, the edges fell off from being poorly made, and it was too salty. If you're here with a larger group, remember what you ordered. When the food comes out, the server will have all the burgers on one tray and all the sides on another, as opposed to serving each person what they ordered individually. Sodas at $3.50 and bottled water at $4 was a bit pricey.   There's a much longer line for a burger at Shake Shack across the street, and maybe that's a tell.

ACJQqre80MhRdFaxt-bYsA.text: A Las Vegas Tradition! Me and the Cuz have to have Fatburger at some point between midnight and 5am during every Vegas trip (no exceptions). It's interesting just to people watch and see who comes in at those hours.   I'm a fan of the fatburger and fat fries ... but they have skinny fries as well. I'm pretty simple at that time in the morning/night.   They really have revamped this place ... the outside is a nice lounge-y area now and they have a slushi bar that I haven't tried yet (definitely going to next time).

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fat Burher and Fat Fries

wvQASRul_oRHYZMh7_fm_Q.text: In dying need of food after waiting in line for 3+ hours at a club that couldn't even get into, my stomach was starting to eat itself. Walking the strip and seeing fat burger was not busy ( 1am sat night ) decided to try this place out. Sitting outside in the patio area, watching drunk people pass by the waitress comes and asks "any drinks?" Umm yes just water for now, since I haven't looked at the menu yet. (Please note, all employees that work here do not wear name tags...ODD)  Waitress comes back again and asks for my order, in which i tell her and brings me another water. Noticing others around me, there was a couple who arrived after me and got their food already. ( Already waiting 20 mins) So i figured my food should be arriving soon then. 40 mins later, food STILL hasn't shown up, now I'm furious. I flag down the waitress and ask her where the food is at and she leaves for another 5 mins, comes back and tells me something happened with my ticket order and the kitchen doesn't have it and she can't find it.....Really?? She then says " Oh I must of thrown it away, what's your order again??" uhh...So i asked for the manager on duty right away and told him what happened. He apologizes and gives me free drinks and a meal. Pshhh waiting an hour for a hamburger....ya no thanks...  Please avoid this place at all costs!

4Gd4-Y6ZxOx7k9ewCkWTGQ.text: Waiting for a flight around midnight and never had Fatburger ever so we went in to try it out. We ordered 3 meals which totalled  $60... food was definitely overpriced for what we got. Everything was crappy and I know I'm never going back. Glad we tried it cause now we know.

gcW2_We4-Hx8eqhRiHSMZQ.text: Was good. Vegas strip  is so busy we got it to go. So by the time we got bk to the resort food was cold. I'd suggest to eat it at the location.

aHpTDpX3jGWv1QzcZPpDKQ.text: We stopped while walking the strip and found an average burger with mediocre choices for beers. They appear to have some specials, but we were never told about them.

1fEmhFLssV3Ryqh5MdbxxA.text: Good burger. Walked in at 2 am with 2 pac blasting and the staff dancing. Lol. Loved it.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PqpZH6sRzrTdWN2iiB9XWg.text: Fat Burger. I had my first Fat Burger in Vegas on my burger run. I have to say the burger is a good burger. It's not in the class of a Bachi's or Gordon Ramsey's burger, but it is a good burger. I would certainly buy it again when I'm in Vegas. 3.5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LAh3xWjeFBT8GuWyzvqgLQ.text: This is convenient because it's on the strip and not buried in the depths of a hotel. There's ample indoor and outdoor seating.   It's a typical Fatburger which means juicy burgers, and the fat fries (nice steak cut fries) are a must. This location is a bit pricey; now this just could be that I haven't been to a Fatburger since I moved away from LA, or their prices are just higher since it's on the strip. I'd go with the latter.  The wait is kinda ridiculous here. There was no one in front of me, and all I ordered was a cheeseburger and fries, and I waited like 30 minutes for my to-go order. Also, my burger came to me way before my fries, even though I was taking it to go, so I was pretty concerned my food was going to get cold. It's weird because loads of others got their fries before me, and I had to ask about my fries after my burger came, so I think they just kinda forgot part of my order.  Ultimately, this was an ok meal. I was in town because my boyfriend was at a convention, so I just wanted to grab something quick and take it back to the room since I was solo at the time. I just really wanted some fat fries though.  In Vegas, there's so many places that are better than this, and probably quicker (and maybe cheaper) that I'd prefer to spend my money elsewhere.   This location is convenient enough to the Tropicana Hotel and MGM though if you need a snack.

X5zNO2BzHtf7Atj5SX3pMQ.text: Big burgers, big prices, fits right into this extravagant city.  I went for the self-seating outdoor bar, famished after a long night.  A quick check of the reviews said that largest size - XXXL - was almost unfinishable due to the size, so I ordered the XXL.  With no bun (paleo!).  And a fried egg.  And bacon.  Because it was technically breakfast.    There is a bit of a wait, but it was bearable - large burgers grilled to order take a bit of time.  What came out was two huge patties, with the cheese, bacon and egg layered on top, resting on some greens, onions and tomatoes on the side.  Although it looked dry, it was juicy and flavorful.  The egg was cooked to over-hard, which was fine.  The bacon was just okay.  I knife and forked it easily (much easier to eat than In-N-Out's Protein style order).  I finished it all, but it was a lot of food - a very fat burger indeed.  The outdoor seating is enjoyable, more so for the view of the tvs by the bar, and the comely staff.  The people watching is a bit muted, from our time there.  Service is attentive.  If I wanted a gut-bomb of a breakfast/lunch, this could be a place I'd go back too.

aZdZVO93ag0mO9uq9HWhFQ.text: Don't bother with this place...  Worst experience ever.  The choice was McDonald's or Fat Burger,  My wife and I decided to try this place more so because McDonald's was crowded and we also wanted to sit down and enjoy a drink or two :)  We walked in bar area and were told by one of the guys cleaning the tables that we could sit at any of the table and order our food and drink there.  Well we waited and waited and we waited a bit more... The lady servers kept ignoring us and a few other people sitting at the other tables... We waited around  30 minutes or more  In the end our patience ran out and we walked out... As we left two young ladies were handing out coupons to people passing by to get them to go in.... Really why... You could not take care of customers who were actually there...    The good news is we did not waste our money on this dive and found a place that served just what we wanted.. sadly no drinks... but awesome customer service... Check out my review on that place and give this dump a miss.

0NJ3WTPhNKFNTtuY4Z0j2Q.text: Aparently they don't  how to put half a vanilla shake and half a strawberry shake together. What really upset me was that the girl who was helping us decided to talk shot about us (the customer) right in front of us. Extremely unprofessional. She also decided to tell me that the woman toasting buns in the back was her manager. What a joke.

_E6Yne7xWaOIOokotOtDbA.text: Burgers are delicious but the waitresses are horrible! They put on sun glasses and so jerk !!!

fF69xCNFLBjhRfUpQJItEQ.text: Nasty. Plain and simple.  I am sure this is the place to grub when you're drunk and don't notice the paint flakes from the chipped-up floor mingling in with your burger, or the caulking from the broken bathroom sink in your fingernails.  The inside of this place is worse than a gas station.  You'd think from the money they pull in from this place they could get a new floor put in and redo the bathroom... WTF?!?  25 minutes to get a burger when we went at 7pm... I could get a starter and entree in that time from 90% of restaurants out there.  Despite that, the burger came out cold. Fries are frozen crap etc etc.  Stay the hell out of this place.

Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything is this pic is broken. Sink barely hanging to wall.

6u9gqHZbtNZOcyxx919P9A.text: The burger was excellent, their fries and onions rings are just as excellent and their pina colada and strawberry drink was beyond great!!! Big thanks to the fellow who helped us! He made us feel very welcomed!

5WDLkHjpmNKscd2O4c5rvA.text: My wife and I grew up with Fatburger in L.A. so we are very familiar with the menu.  We stopped in on our way home from Vegas and I had the Large with cheese, bacon and egg along with fat fries. Best burger I've had in a while. The staff was friendly and aside from feeling like a child having to ask the manager to open the restrooms it was a very pleasant experience. We'll be back.

ZssBSR-eAy0B9o-C1w5LGA.text: Summary/TLDR - Wonderful service, $40 for 2 people (pricey), good burger but could use more flavor. It's a higher class Steak n Shake. Would visit again.  Food - 6/10 Service - 10/10 Atmosphere - 8/10 Wait Time - 8/10  Stopped in because I heard this place was decent. Ordered a 1/3# breakfast burger (burger, egg, bacon, cheddar) and they had an advertisement for free fries with a purchase of a draft beer, so naturally, I jumped on this offer. We ended up getting charged for the fries, went back up, the cashier had recognized us and his mistake, apologized and admitted he got a bit flustered with the line that was forming behind us. The fact that he straight up admitted he made a mistake, without trying to dance around the issue, really made me appreciate the service here. So he called over the manager and they were going to refund us, which I know can be a pain, so I asked if we could get onion rings instead, and the manager (without hesitation) said yes. FANTASTIC SERVICE. The onion rings were brought right over.  I'm pretty picky when it comes to breakfast burgers. I can say this wasn't the best I've ever had, but it was better than some of the worst. The meat could've used more flavor, but regardless, a good burger!  It was a tad bit expensive though. For 2 breakfast burgers, 1 beer, and fries was $40...

yctPuXVoM3FbeqefOnQJAQ.text: Fatburger, get the large burger with bacon, a handful of fresh veggies and a fried egg, your heart will hate you but you won't regret it.  After a late night of partying on the strip, my girlfriend and I, along with a buddy of mine, decided to check out FatBurger for a late night snack.  The atmosphere was really nice, its a fast food joint that looks like a diner serving up burgers made to order, pretty crafty!  Ordered their large 8oz burger with the works, cheese, fried egg and bacon with a side of fries.  I know it sounds like a lot but you live once, and you know what they say, what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas!  Burger was tasty but way too greasy, even if I were to take out the egg and bacon, by the time I got back to my hotel the bag was already soaked with grease.  It's awesome for those who want to try something new, they open 24/7 on the strip so its very convenient for those looking for a late meal.  I'd come back again if I'm hungry but definitely not something that I'd choose as a first option.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s6VVVnc2dAiWKSol-Ro1Ow.text: I like Fatburger, usually. I walked down the strip and was accosted by people handing out cards - buy one drink, get one free. Sounds good, right?   I go inside to order my burger, and try to order my drafts (the tap is right next to the cash register). She tells me I have to go outside to the bar to order the drinks. Whatever. So I go outside. I try and order two shock tops. No deal. She says the second draft has to be a domestic. I remind her it's made in America. Still no deal. I look at the card and it says nothing about this. So, I'm forced to order a bud light to comply with their unwritten policy.   I like the food, but hate having to jump through hoops just to claim an offer they're handing out. Fix the service, and I'm happy.

FPAa7kmEGsyq5NCuT6n68g.text: Not a bad place overall. I think the burgers are just as good as anybody can make them. It doesn't take a scientist to make a burger. I do like that it's made from sratch and stuff. You get to pick your own topings and stuff. I think it was like $1.00 for cheese.  I didn't have a beer or booze, it was all food.   It's pricey because of the location, but it's not going to cost you an arm and a leg. So if you really are in a need for a burger, and your on the stripe, I guess this is the place to go to, that or Denny's.

uUA4w8AA5HUdpC6Rg5X5rQ.text: Good burger yet a bit over priced. Then again its Vegas and most is. Burger was very tasty, fries were good and Strawberry shake was good too. Overall, just what it needed to be.

They did some renovations to this location and that may explain their prices. The reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because of the price. If you buy two combo meals the price will run you close to $30.

exj5eCsSvfq436eAZWBWiA.text: Liars! Rep outside handed us a coupon for $5 off any refillable containers, when the check came the waitress said sorry only applies for new purchases only. Complained that I will never return to Fat Burger!

dYTNfEJkg_fmhO10VP5ODw.text: They seriously have the best buffalo chicken sandwich I have ever tasted! Fresh veggies, delicious sauces and thick hunks of meat all on a butter-toasted bun for a reasonable $5.60 plus tax.   I would have given this five stars, but the service was pretty poor. All the same, I still recommend this place over the McDonalds next door.

HpVYF7kVvHIgQ3soPwRoig.text: Went to Vegas last year, and I'm still thinking about the burgers here!  The place was right across the street from my hotel - so convenient!  I passed by this place a few times, with no intentions of going inside.  At around 3AM on a Wednesday, after a great time on the strip, was heading back to the hotel, and I was hungry.  It was practically empty inside.  I'm so happy I went here!!  I had the Small (Baby Fat) Fatburger with cheese, bacon and an egg. DELICIOUS!!  I'm drooling right now...  The skinny fries were great too.  I even made a trip to In-N-Out sometime the next day - my first time there actually.  Although it was good, I preferred Fatburger, and made more trips here instead!  The location was convenient, and the people that worked there were really nice, funny actually.  People have said that they have encountered shady customers.  However, I went there a few times between 1-4AM, and all I saw were tourists, like myself. Maybe I was just lucky.  I miss you Fat Burger!

This place was not busy at all, but it took over 20 minutes to get someone to help us. We had to go up to a server to ask to place an order. After we got our slushies and fries, they did not taste good at all. I did not taste alcohol in the drink and the fries were soggy.

3EqzaJBJLnJIceIaX2krTA.text: I was told that you can't go to Las Vegas and not stop in Fatso Burger   Well worth the stop, I grabbed a couple of burgers and fries at 3 am   Fabulous !!

Lpsme7_jBWCwNKnj-Ehc2w.text: We stopped in to have lunch here.  The location is fantastic; there's patio seating right on the strip and plenty of televisions playing the Sunday games.  The burgers, beer, and service were all really good.

qA-o2i-WRZ1hAkinUlPVRg.text: One of the best, down home, non-fancy burgers I've had in the U.S.!  The only one I can think of which beats FB's burger is The Shack Stack at Shake Shack (NYC).  But FB is a must stop place if you're akin to we folk who can look past the super grody conditions of the "dining" area and dig into this fatty, greasy, unhealthy, heart-stopping piece of perfection which is otherwise known as the Heaven-sent accompaniment to the twelve drinks you just slammed over the past two hours ;-)

Burgers were pretty good, I tried mine with an egg added. Fries were good, we tried the thick cut fries.   We didn't spend much time here since we were on a schedule zipping around Vegas! -H_WzFelz4VsRKNn2rlPjg.text: This, was probably my favorite burguer place... only at the Beverly Hills - LA.  At the store in Las Vegas, was a poor experience. I bought a XXXL Burguer, with 3x 1/2 pound patties, only the burguer... no soda, no fries... and they charged full meal. When I received, the meat was well done, I asked for medium rare, with egg, everything was burned. At the cook place, a lot of people making jokes with each other's.  I feels disrespected as a customer. My order was $40 bucks and I think, I should eat better at McDonalds.

Ordered the small burger with bacon and cheese and a small order of chili cheese fries. The chili cheese fries were basic. I think this may be the finally chance for here for me.

xfKUoad294bi5wtfuMB7_w.text: First time at a Fatburger.  It was just OK for me.  Bun was OK, burger was dry.  I did however love their fries....the thick kind, hot and cooked perfectly.  Clean restaurant, good service.

JKVmqLvKh7imeZcVkALzig.text: I ordered at 11 and didn't receive my food until 11:30 and there wasn't really that many people there to warrant that long wait time.  Food was good as well as service sans the wait time.  Came here in February and didn't wait nearly as long with 4x as many people there

-NAtrzpkZ00Ks_y_sY6usA.text: Came here for drinks but ended up ordering burgers too. A fast food joint with alcohol?! COME ON! The chicken burger didn't even taste like fast food, it was sooo goooood! Almost gourmet.. maybe ? I enjoyed the fat fries also.  We got two large drinks and a fat fry for $42 on Groupon-- well worth it. I'd highly recommend the strawberry margarita.  The waitress recommended strawberry and Miami vice, I honestly didn't like this at all. I felt as though she was rushing to take our order and didn't seem genuinely interested in giving suggestions.  Also, we asked for the bill but stayed for a few mins after it was brought to us. Right away the amount of the bill and 20% tip was placed into the bill holder.  About 20 mins after getting the bill, we gathered our stuff to leave. The waitress passed by and saw us near the exit and said "did you ladies leave the bill?" ... clearly we asked for it --- why wouldn't we leave it?  I might be overthinking but that was just weird since a group of females sitting at the bar got up.. left and weren't asked if they paid. Actually, our waitress never even asked if we were doing okay during our time there.

fm69agFx45ZjgAVIEIsm7Q.text: This is a bit of a hipster style Fatburger, it has an outdoor bar with WAY Overpriced Drinks and Beer, and Fatburgers average fare. The burgers are what they are, but they too are way overpriced as are the Fries! A Burger, Fries, and a Beer is probably gonna run you about $21.00 for mediocre fast food. The music is blaring, and it's in a crappy strip mall in a dingy part of the strip, so you're not even paying for atmosphere. Overall if you're drunk and hungry a burger here isn't a horrible choice, but be prepared to pay top dollar!

WspFH9rKYBtVs7Xu5ewdcw.text: It's average. Acceptable. Passable. Not great. Not terrible. It's just there.  The big draw is the size of the burgers, hence the name. You can get something as small as 2.5 oz. to as big as 16-24 oz. (2 or 3 of their eight ounce patties) If you have a big appetite and money to spare you won't leave here hungry. The meat itself tasted bland, though, and lacked flavor. I wanted to like it, but there was just something missing.  Even the fries were OK at best. There is something cool about them, though - you can get them in three different styles - skinny (shoestring), fat (almost steak-fry like) and in a sweet potato variety. So there's something for everyone here.  A word of warning - at this Las Vegas strip establishment, the prices are jacked up compared to regular Fatburger restaurants. It's the price you pay for eating near the action.

uZFSwurujHam8-4-EG2ubw.text: Fat burger is great for a midnight snack. Every time I come to Las Vegas I make sure I stop there. Late night hamburgers perfect. crowd you may come across suspect but that all depends on when you go to Vegas overall if you're in Vegas to party you must stop at fat burger to feed the alcohol

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/3 burger so imagine the Double or triple burger

wOx7SvT0RrOtg8hqFo6eFg.text: Gave them another chance after Uber Eats delivered a freezer cold burger to me.... The in restaurant experience was amazing! Burger was good and fries were too !!

KSQh9rH9q56IBHO5V-iCrw.text: My Uber driver recommended Fat Burger. Walking inside smelled like moldy beach water or old mop water. There was a horrible smell coming from the back are. It made the whole joint stink. I couldn't even smell the food being freshly prepared.   I ordered the turkey burger and mom ordered the chicken sandwich. We split a side of onion rings. Simple!   The turkey burger was seasoned and cooked really well. Very juicy. The chicken sandwich was good according to mom. However, after being told there was an extra charge for cheese, mom asked for NO cheese on her sandwich. she was charged for it anyway, and it was added.  The onion rings were fried crispy but juicy!   Would I visit again? Yes for the food, but only if I knew the smell wouldn't be a problem in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich. Mom asked for NO cheese but was charged for it anyway.
Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey.Burger

eV_ds7z5i42ZqzD5OI6YjQ.text: The Fries of all shapes and sizes here are on the money. I parked behind this place for like $5 or something; some sketch guy is like: "give me five bucks, and you can leave it here all day!" "Is it safe back here in this rando' parking lot?" "Yeah, dude. Here, put this raffle ticket in your window. You'll be good all day." I left about $4k worth of personal items in the truck, and then stumbled into this Fatburger on the strip.   First time I've ever had it, and I could eat this every day if necessary. Not world-class food, or life changing by no means. But me and my fiance split an original burger and fries, and it was enough to get us up and down the strip for the afternoon for around $8. I suggest splitting it, because it's a lot of food - hence, Fatburger. And honestly, you're in Vegas; if you don't understand that great food is easily found everywhere, you're missing a huge part of what makes that place even bearable. Honestly, eat the Fatburger for fuel, in order to get you to some True greatness down the street.  The place seemed clean, and honestly, we had lunch there for two days. I don't mind it, but on the cheap, it can be had quick. Try a shake too, if that's your thing, because they looked great. Avoid it a little after hours though, cause it can get gamey with the drunkards and sorted riff raff.

epp6HTZPrMJnlNpRwVncDg.text: cool , decent hamburger spot.  The location is great, right on the strip.  Great food after a good day/night of drinking.  Burgers were good, u can add on some items, like eggs, bacon, chili.  That's to give your mouth more flavors to enjoy.  The burgers are big, not like you typical burger shacks. I would dine here again and recommend.

I decided to take on the XXXL Challenge and demolished the burger.  I am now 'King of All Carnivores", or in other words The Burger King.  Grab yourself a FAT BURGER.

CKyfgjLIwZcrb4wXs_OuSw.text: Worst Fatburger experience ever.  A Fatburger, fries and chocolate shake was$17 + change.  Parking was $5.  $22 is way too much for Fatburger.  Some advice, go to InNOut up the street.

7VcmsG3-P_KUgZMzn4BULw.text: Maybe it was the time of night, or maybe we just caught a bad crew or maybe every one else is super drunk when they done here so it's delicious to them, not sure but our food wasn't good in the least bit. My burger was burnt and dried out and so were my two friends. But, if you check in on yelp and show the bartender, you'll get a free shot...which you'll need if your burger is prepared like mine was. Good luck!

-svNobYTgiRoFYPfXjwFmw.text: Went to eat there Thursday night and had a miss communication about our bill. We ate 5 burgers and were charged for ten. They claimed one of us went up to the bar and ordered 5 more burgers and fries (it was actually another table who went to the bar and threw 5 more burgers on our tab) I've worked in the restaurant business my entire life and have never seen anyone pay twice the amount that they ate. I would have never payed this bill obviously but the security and bartenders bullied me into paying the entire 166 dollar bill. They threatened me to the point I had to pay the bill or I was gonna get beaten up. I feared for my own well being which is insane to me because all we wanted to do was get some food before bed. These are all facts I would never advise ANYONE to eat at this establishment

ZT4to4p4r9LpCsqExNsGdA.text: Good food, just high as hell.  Could have came out better going to In N Out.  5 stars because the food is great and the quick service is even greater!

GgB8rkCabFapR2GPWH1rAA.text: This place is full of shit...worst service ever!!!!!!! We order 6 burger and 3fries, they took over 1hour when is not busy at all.....when they bring ours foods, they were disrespectful. Bring your business some where else, worst Fat burger ever!!!!!!!!

5CJP7y-0BsQNPwo7cxor-w.text: We eat here for lunch whenever we visit. Great spot at the edge of the street to people watch and plenty of TVs to catch your favorite game.  Only thing that would make this place better is having different meat options for their burgers. A restaurant with "burger" in its name should have healthy (lean) ground beef options. After all, this isn't a fast food stop.

oXM1foZDv4eM37DZ3m9dCw.text: Love that this place is always open! Buy one get one drinks! Our drink server was really sweet. Has a perfect view of the Las Vegas strip. We went here both nights in vegas. Will definitely be back again.

EH52-dz3Krq28dkh-oWRlw.text: This place is open way past 9pm.  In fact I think it's 24 hours.  I just know my receipt says 345am.  MAYBE because it was a weekend.  Okay now to the nitty gritty.  Have you ever had a fatburger before? Okay remember this IS a chain...so that means the burgers whether in NYC, LA, Dtown, MIA or Vegas...they WILL taste the same and NO you are NOT missing anything by waiting to go back home.    The service...ONE guy was really nice and chipper and we waited too long to decide what we wanted so the other guy took care of us and well he was long overdue going home it seems.  Yes the burgers are pricey, and what puts this place over the 3 stars is the FULL bar! FULL BAR AND BURGERS! and  they are not skimpy with the pour on that liquor!   so 4 stars because it's a decent burger, it's open at and indecent time and you have a full bar in a cool outdoor atmosphere RIGHT on the strip! Nice to be out and in the mix.

hORm0RaTkfwp49gKfaADQA.text: My family and I came in here thinking it was going to be a quick and cheap dinner... Wrong! We spent $90 and waited 50 mins for our food. We ordered 5 burgers, 4 fries, and 2 shakes. I would've got faster service and cheaper food if I would've drove 10 mins out of this area. Disappointed, dissatisfied, Never again.

R4Ud7vL6049CcuTrlUlCSQ.text: Veggie Burger in Vegas! For vegetarians on the Vegas strip, this is a good pick! Being an Ovo-Lacto veg head I had the veggie burger with cheese and a fried egg. Messy as hell and good as shit! (that's a compliment) My friends liked the regular burgers, the only "meh" to be heard was for the chicken strips. The staff was excellent. We had a group of about fifteen and the service was great. Outdoor seating with misting to keep it cool. Wish we had them in Atlanta!

KVG1XWun7tOkjIxrQ8Qd5w.text: How can you not love this place. Open late, right on the strip, not too overpriced, great food, all the good stuff. So its 3am and we've been walking the strip and most like several beers in. I'm in town for a convention and havent had a really good meal since i arrived. The co-worker i'm with says "We gotta go to Fat Burger". Being from the East Coast i had never heard of it, so I decided to give it a shot. Place looks nice enough, will have to go without beer for a half hour. I get in line, look at the menu, and decide the burger is where its at. I get up front and see a sign "Free fries with purchase of beer". What? They serve beer here too?  Hence the 4 up to 5 stars. So the burger was fantastic, and really hits the spot at that time in the evening/morning. The fat fries were just regular steak fries, but man those burgers hit the spot. Looking forward to going back my next time out west.

c7wnuYA5rDPano260k4RtQ.text: I went to Las Vegas for the first time in June, it was also my first trip to Fatburger. I cam here a couple weeks after Mayweather had his infamous melee here. Anyhow, back to the food. I came here twice during my stay and it was excellent. I went with the cheeseburger and fries. They allow you to choose the size of your burger and fries, which I liked. The burger was well seasoned and the prices are reasonable. I will definitely eat at this place when I visit Vegas again!!!

dA5aXflBP6LbwYhfskYc2w.text: No thanks this restaurant is very overrated & overpriced i was a big fan , In & Out will always be better

HnJKPLACtpIqUg9KE74I5w.text: Has to be the best burger. Add a fried egg to make it even better. Love the fat fries and onion rings too. But its the burgers you have to try. Everything tastes so fresh. Their is a size for everyone. If you think you can try the XXXL challenge. My brother did in April (a little disappointed that is picture isn't up as promised with the challenge). They have shakes and an outdoor bar as well. The best fat burger we've been too!

nrEQ3N3aupvqOYHhBHwYCg.text: I had purchased a Groupon awhile back and never had the chance to use it so it had expired. Recently I read the terms and conditions and it noted that I can speak to the vendor directly and that the money I paid for the Groupon never expires (suh-weeet). We head over to FatBurger and are told to speak to the bar staff. The man behind the counter quickly verified that the voucher was never redeemed and gave us two alcoholic slushies in souvenir cups, featuring up to 50 ounces of drink with 1.25 ounces of alcohol per 10 ounces of slushie ($30 value each) One large order of Fat Fries ($3.20 value). Fries came out quick, fresh, and crispy!

0YuMOT2GLU3MG0SIc8tVKg.text: I went to Fatburger in Las Vegas late one night. I was expecting typical diner food. I did not feel like a beef burger, so I ordered the turkey burger.  I swear I heard trumpets and caught a glimpse of heaven when I bit into this burger. The burger was huge, however after the first bite it rapidly disappeared.   The best turkey burger ever.  I'm happy to learn there is a Fatburger about an hour from me. I hope their turkey burger is good as the one in Vegas.

gQKT2_SHZ32sw2f4WvUtLg.text: I was just out here a month ago, and wow this Fatburger location is great. Ordered i believe a triple burger to go with everything on it. The fries are slamming big time yum. I decided to come over and grab some food to take home at 1:30am . This location also has a bar outside of it, nice outside bar. Had a few drinks talking and chatting with some of the locals. Fatburgers in L.A are not as good as they used to be, but there are great spots in Los Angeles for a good fatburger. Really recommend eating at this strip location.

2xYxs_Ji6bYopOzOyxc6Hw.text: Stopped here with a Groupon and SUPER glad I did.  2x 50oz frozen drinks with fries was the groupon deal I go but added a burger since me and the BF were hungry.  Sat at the bar immediately with no wait and a super friendly bar staff.  Super chill environment with great music that took me back to high school in SoCal circa 1996.  If you want a great burger and great drinks in a laid back place, Farburger is the joint to hit up. Farburger, love the burgers, drinks, music, and tattoos!

tk4Poo9XgDEt7Y5-KRVGeg.text: Put it like this..... You come to Vegas and expect nothing but the best!   This restaurant lives up to that! The bartender is super friendly and drinks are reasonable! By far one of the best places on the strip so far!   If your into drinking stick to the outdoor bar!

LlborxfG5rUeh36BXXWSHg.text: Overrated!! Employees were friendly, but if this is suppose to be the "best burger" spot in Vegas..no thank you! Crispy Chicken sandwich was decent and their shakes are tasty, but the burger was horrible! No flavor and dry, dry buns!

xPNbLaonGzZYVuWihm-Blg.text: 5 stars for waitress and atmosphere!   Had a great experience with waitress Aurora very sweet girl and helpful for info about area.   However food dropped down to 3 stars. Burger was made to order bun could have been a little fresher. Fries was not good at all, they seemed to be recooked several times causing to be chewey.  But Drinks were amazing!!!!

8gILsV1S1KWzDQqg1VsHXA.text: No beating around the bushes, it's a fat burger! They're not trying to make a healthy statement with grain free buns, organic ingredients or grass fed beefs, just a really good tasting burger.   First of all, my fiends and I were staying in the central strip and so walking here made all the sense in the world. Can't comment on parking. I remembered my dad saying that this was one of their favorite burgers in Vegas. So I dragged my hungry friends for a ten minute walk just past Planet Hollywood. They kept saying let's just settle for this and that, but I said do you have this place where you're from??? Nope.  When we got there, at the entrance some guy passing out cards, gave us a BOGO drink coupon each for this place. Then we sat and waited. They don't have enough servers, and we were hungry. It was nice out, so we sat outside.   Finally a pleasant server came and took our orders and honored our fresh BOGO cards, score! Then we waited. Finally our drinks arrived, nothing special just a draft beer, but something to keep us company while yet again waiting.   Our burgers arrived, and I must say they are huge! I got a 1/3 pounder and one of my friends got the 1/2 pounder! It's not cheap, but for the size of this masterpiece I thought it was worth it. It was delicious, and filling. Didn't feel like I had to eat again for 4-6 hours later.   Overall the burgers we all agreed were excellent in taste, freshness, and ability to fill you up. The restaurant itself was kind of dirty because they didn't clear tables quick so it would blow on the ground. The wait was something not everyone would tolerate so well, but if you want a good burger and don't want to break the bank, this is a great spot for that.

bro0hsLrLSgud4U3-70Y1Q.text: This rating is for the drinks and they guy that took our order. I got a Groupon as a gift for two half sized drinks. They were huge!!! Plus the bartender was great! She was personable and very helpful. They guy that took our order was great. He was efficient and read our order back to make sure he got it right. The food was sub par to say the least. I remember when fatburger lived up to its name. Now its just not worth it. I'd go back for the drinks but not the food.

OvMJ6o0G1KNw8dCEOKreCQ.text: I went with the XXXL after a full day of walking Vegas. I finished the whole thing easily since I was so hungry. I didn't try anything else for the XXXL is pretty darn big. Plenty.   Service was great by Deebo who was tending the outside bar. The patio is heated with TVs right there  along the strip.   The burger was good. It hit the spot after miles of walking. Nice atmosphere but Vegas prices for a big burger. After tip, the bill was around $22 for just myself.

cTuAJBWDdw92Joa8UovTaw.text: One of the better burger places I've been to in general. The interior was decent seem like any other typical burger joint would look like nothing really special on how the interior looks.  What really is good is the burger now that thing is amazing. I got the XXXL burger which was the biggest size they offer. With 3 meat patties and ton of condiments and cheese in-between whats not to like about this burger(that's coming from the fat kid that's inside me). Either way it was amazing had this nice juicy burger and will fill you up especially the XXXL burger and the sweet potato fried are the real deal as well.  Only thing that bummed me out was that i finished the XXXl burger and in the back i noticed they have like a wall for people that finished that burger. I wished someone would of told me so i could of gotten on that wall and also a certificate on it. But oo well i guess =\  Over great place, now what are you wating for go give it a try yourself.

CSKhKVmU91RN1nnQvqtvKA.text: Came for the impossible burger. Yet another place with no vegan bun and the lettuce here is shredded so a wrap won't happen. It was tasty but still annoyed that when you say vegan they don't know what that is. The wife got a real meat burger and it looked good.

I've had the fat fries, sweet potato fries, skinny fried, onion rings and they are all good. Today I had the fat fries with cheese. :) I've had the French toast.. I can say mine is better. ;)

aUpN1tauDsqupE_qOcPeCA.text: Stopped here for a bite to eat and was surprised to find out they had a brunch menu and $5 mimosas. I had the Eggs Benedict, which was pretty good. I would definitely have it again. The service was great and everyone working there seemed really nice.

KdfvjMjDyF1s7sKrixhP2A.text: Fat Burger has been around since 1952 but I finally got a chance to try it on the Las Vegas strip . I got the large cheese burger with everything. It even comes with pickle relish which you dont see at your regular fast food joint. The huge burger was cooked perfectly.  I ordered the steak fries what they called large fries.  They were the best I've ever had. None of that seasoned salt just plain old American white salt. The tab for the cheese burger large fries and a medium drink was $20.19. There are a lot of good burger joints in Vegas.  This is one of the best.

8Uz8nAdobgmnPNbyfndH-Q.text: Burger is expensive for what you get. I do like that it is all hand made. The smallest size they have is about the size of a slider. Everything together was pretty decent.  You can have the onions grilled or however you choose which is really cool.   Would I try it again? Not really. I would prefer a different burger join of cheaper price. But if friends wanted to go eat it, I would be glad to go eat it.

UnNv4oso2JD-UjbftRJ3uA.text: Loved the medium fat burger and onion rings. Shake was great too. Sitting outside in the mist was brilliant in the heat of a summer night. Good service and quality burger.

thSbEADrsWUkGVN3EWlXzA.text: The famous Fatburger! We stopped here around 12:30 a.m. on our first night in town after a long day of flying into Vegas at 6 a.m. and then perusing the strip. We all got a Fatburger and fries, and they had some deal going where you got your fries free if you got a draft beer. Definitely a good deal with the high prices of Vegas. The burgers were good, but in my opinion just your basic quick burger. Not the best burger I've ever had, but I'm glad I checked it out. The outdoor/patio bar is great too on a nice summer night!

J1vDh263PL-NBi6vb16Ggg.text: My kids love Fatburgers!  After sitting in crappy traffic on the Strip, enjoying a sightsee of all the pretty lights, I was able to do a U-turn and hit this place.  The parking was a breeze even if you do have to shoo people out of the way from crossing the driveway, which is nonstop.  Sorry, move the F out of the way, I'm coming in because I'm hungry enough to jump out and start chewing on one of you people.  We got in and there was no crowd.  I have to warn you here, FB is pricey, but we knew that already.  I just ordered for the one daughter, but my other one decided she wanted McDonald's; me too.  Woo-hoo, McDeath's is just next door!!!!  Sweet!  So got one kid situated outside at the open air seating, complete with open bar and misters.  Please, if you're a slow eater, sit away from the misters because they spray every other second and it does get annoying after a bit.  We went to the McD's next door and luckily avoided a big gang of folks who herded in.    It was very nice sitting there people-watching out on the strip.  A nice calm evening with my teenagers, watching guys hand out X-rated flyers to passers-by.    Leaving is the same hassle as coming in because I had to darn near run over folks to leave because they don't care if you've been sitting there a while waiting to LEAVE!  Fortunately, I'm from back East and have a A-card on guerrilla driving.  MOVE!  So just be prepared to be a little proactive in that department.

DRgMkTBC_2t5Ycb1-uzQnA.text: My friends and I were walking along the strip when we overheard some guys talking about Fatburger. One of the guys mentioned a fried egg that they on your burger, so we were determined to try it at that moment! When we finally arrived at Fatburger, we were hesitant about entering cause it looked kinda shady, but we finally built up the courage.   Their menu doesn't really offer much to choose from. The only unique option that they have is the fried egg. I had the medium burger with skinny fries. I opted out of the fried egg since it didn't seem appealing to me anymore. The burger wasn't bad, but it seemed like a poor In-N-Out imitation. The skinny fries were crispy even though we walked all the way back to our hotel room before gorging. Overall, it was decent and cheap. I'd definitely choose Fatburger over the McDonalds next door though.
