4Bo0yxgdTX2Iuglz0sCgoA.text: Had an overall great experience at Fatburger the managers employees at everyone else just had a smile on my face the entire time 10 out of 10 performance by the company would recommend if you ever are stopping by fat burger

2lU3wUl0cEYJk1XLcpZ6Pg.text: I don't have much to say. It's a burger. It's fat. It's a FAT BURGER!!  You have a huge appetite get the XXL with all the fixings and then some.  This is one of my fist stops when in Vegas or Los Angeles areas. By far my fave burger joint, EVER!

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Medium with cheese and bacon skinny fries on the side

e0y22r6MH8iNdMvqpjDOQg.text: The burgers are decent they are way better in Inglewood though and they racist and rude as hell. I had to ask 5 different people to take a piss, white dude walk right in and he took right to it. Who has a bar with a locked washroom in Vegas of all places.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vb8Vp7H5nzQCUJYMx_O-nw.text: 3.5/5  I'm by no means a burger expert, but I can tell if a burger is good in the sense of juiciness. This place wasn't bad, however I prefer In-N-Out over Fatburger if I were to live in the western US. If only the In-N-Out in Las Vegas was actually on The Strip proper...but I did plan to explore more next time I'm in Vegas.  I had two medium Fatburgers with onion rings for one of them. Believe it or not, the onion rings here are much better than the burgers. I love o-rings that are huge in size, and the fact the onions were also large in size (it's not just batter). This place has both aimed spot on! As for the burgers...I like the fact there are different sizes for the burgers, cause there's no way I'm eating a XL. I also like the fact the burgers are lean beef, so it's less unhealthy for you, although that might have contributed to why I find the burgers not as juicy as In-N-Out.  Again if I had to choose between Fatburger and In-N-Out, it's In-N-Out all the way. However Fatburger is also a great choice for those Vegas folks who don't wanna leave The Strip and want something that's not a buffet or splurge restaurant for a change.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fatburgers and onion rings.

UREmUPFC_N6ELr8AyaaS-Q.text: Thought my tip would suffice but seeing some bad reviews of the place I just need to put mine in.   The first time I ever tried Fat Burger was maybe three years ago. I never had any reason not to go to In N Out for a good and fast diner burger. But one drunken night we were in some casino (Red Rock?) where there was conveniently located, a Fat Burger. I can't deny a good old fashioned burger drunk or sober so it was on.   I'm not dumb or close minded so I wasn't gonna compare them to In N Out or any other burger. Not every burger wants to be an In N Out burger, some burgers just wanna be themselves damnit. I really like this fat guy! He's more than doable for me and I was an instant fan.    Plain hamburger all day every day. I'm old school. I'd eat it between sandwich bread. The patty is hand formed and made to order and while the flavor is not out of this world it is close to out of the ballpark for me. Not bad at all. I've returned many times to this location.   Speaking of which, you'd think it's my favorite Fat Burger since there's a full bar outside. Nope. It's actually my least favorite and specifically because of the bar. The service out there sucks big baseballs. Doesn't matter if it's winter or summer, they be freezing. I've never seen so many man bitches. Soo rude and grumpy and not taking any pride in the place like the other workers inside and at their other locations. That's what confuses me. The workers inside at the counter where you order your food are excellent just like the guys at the casino. The manager here was professional and even the cooks were upbeat. I felt extremely welcomed inside and then entirely snubbed outside.   But unless I'm feeling sensitive, it's the food that I really care about. I'd eat a decent burger from a Yankee fan I would. This here will be my drunk burger.   I've had the garden burger which I liked fine, but I love frozen garden burgers, so. I tried the turkey burger and it was also fine so I stick to beef since we're all so fine. I prefer In N Outs protein burger because I like the full lettuce wrap as opposed to a salad set up they have here. I'll add bacon and cheese to my burgers if it's one of those nights but if I'm really trying to party I'll add an onion ring to a plain or cheeseburger. Hell yes. The onion rings are what keep me comin. Home run baby. My fave onion ring I've found in burger land.

RF8SXUWfizBA3BGLzTkIYg.text: Haven't been here for years! Hamburger have gotten a bit small since last time I was here but super good meal regardless. Staff was really friendly and fast service.  Only wished their burgers were bigger like they used to be....

TI4RH5hVMVq4pIvkBQMPoQ.text: Jack, was very awesome!  He was funny and had quality customer service! He made me and my mother laugh as we were ordering! There should be more people like him working in any customer service industry! He had a very pleasant personality. He truly made our experience in Vegas amazing! He would be the reason we would eat at Fat Burger as we only came to order fries. He deserves a promotion!!!!

sKbjgIfQTyC5f6qqNAvcfg.text: Place was ok. Thought it was pricey Hamburger and Fries 15.00. Late night not much else open so it was just ok.

dZPSrNLhnHSr8fG4y8pBNg.text: Erick, swing shift manager is amazing. Great guy thank you Erick for making our vegas trip amazing.

sq9uswmgGaat15lrKVyYww.text: Came here for those awesome fries and a coke zero. They have ranch and mustard for dippin on request

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this place. Good music, good food, and its open late.
Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Gz9RLV283LiM6g8MUa8ewQ.text: Don't come here ever! Margarita are weak they don't put any liquor on them...and they charge you $11 !!!! Staff is extremely rudeeeeeeeee

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IpGzeNMOE9PMOsb5fd5kcA.text: Ambience. B Service. A Food. A Price. A  Open 24/7!  The Mgr recognized even after my 2nd time after two. Days. Nice friendly Service taking orders and patient in options and getting what you want!   They are constantly cleaning.  It's hard to clean up after a drunkenly Vegas strip and they strive to get it done.  Even to the bathrooms.  Stop making a mess people!  I ordered my burger with everything with extra pickles and lettuce.  Gives a nice sourly crunch with each bite.  The fat fries were nice and hot and fluffy inside. Mayo with my fries please!  Total. Under $11!  Glad they were open. As it was hard to find good food around this part at this early morning hour.   I'm a fan early this morning a 4 am!  Burp!

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice and hot fat fries with burger all the way with extra lettuce and pickles!

Hh2P13LZ11sqL_9N5s6brw.text: This is definitely my guilty pleasure burger spot, as it is not healthy in any way. They do have the best vegan BOCA burger in Vegas. A few other spots have the BOCA patty but all the other elements that make their burgers come no where close to taste and portions like Fat Burger does. They also offer a GARDEN patty but something about the hearty taste of the BOCA wins. They use a 5oz patty instead of the 3oz like the other places use, it's meatier and filling. A giant plus.   Their combination of mustard, lettuce, tomato, pickles, relish & onion are simple and delicious. I order mine with extra pickles and both raw and grilled onions with no mayo, so satisfying. Order with fat fries and you won't regret it.  One complaint, get a gluten free bun that doesn't have egg in it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm burger

99QW29MuRBN7kBG2XE05UA.text: Got a regular burger with no cheese. The beef patty was spot on and just how I remember it. Got an order of the chili cheese fries too. At first they didn't load my fries up with enough cheese or chili. I let them know and they were happy to make another one for me. Finally, I had to complete my meal with a Oreo shake. Hat was delicious too.

xfop2p40Pmh0e8VAdUjNWQ.text: Not clean , floors sticky and the tables are not clean. Smells like sulfur when you walk in.   Half the lights on the building are out, this store is rundown and needs some TLC.   FATBURGER used to be worth the $9 burger. Not anymore.

QsF-4PWVyqJqMVJ5weEaBQ.text: This was my very first time coming and I felt really good eating this delicious burger. I had the 1000 Island Burger and it was very good. Their chili cheese fries are good as well. This place is definitely worth another time out to try out again.

iv6eKbehNWqxtiUxy4bcqQ.text: Some friends and I decided to give this place a try after enjoying a night on the strip.   Lots of pros here:  1. Open 24 hours, which is perfect after a night of walking the strip and partying.   2. Lots of menu options. Whether you like turkey burgers, veggie burgers, a paleo burger, or shake, this is your stop.   3. Friendly staff. The service is great.   4. The food is really good. Especially the onion rings and the shake.   Cons:  1. restroom is kind of nasty.   2. Because the food is so good...the line is long.   3. Even though I enjoyed my food, I felt it was a bit overpriced. I paid $18.00 for my burger, onion rings, and shake.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garden burger with onion rings. Delish!!
Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bn0w9acFBV-zdpFBrSQTYQ.text: My experience at Fat burger was truly a experience. I visited this location and the cashier was so nice, however I couldn't understand why she was the only person working the register when 10 - 12 other employee's were standing around and just talking and having a great time. I found that to be really rude because my group had a lot of people and the ordering process might have went faster if another employee cam to the register.   I ordered the turkey burger and steak fries. I was really please with the way the burger turned out. The turkey was not dried out or flavorless. However the young lady that dropped the burger off to the table had a massive amount of weave in her head. I am not knocking her for that but if your going to serve food I personally think you should have all of that hair in a bun to avoid it from touching my food. Overall the food was really good and the cashier was great but the other areas discussed needs lots of improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original Fat Burger with steak fries

du-rJfb7qXxFwb3GYfg3IA.text: My husband and I had the original Fat burger with the fat fries and a coke. It was all delicious. The food was almost $30 for the 2 of us, which was pricey, but it seems like everything is Vegas is expensive. The service was fast and friendly. The food was good, but it's a little overrated.

HYF9stR3ZlwqmLZnpxUVig.text: I've always loved fat burger every time i come to las vegas, but this time they gotten my order wrong. As i ordered my burger i told the cashier no bun and ended up with a bun anyways, and i didn't want to send it back because i don't know what the cooks will do to my food if i send my food back. I good thing about it was my oreo cookie shake was soooooo delicious, don't know what type of ice cream they use for they shakes, but it was very good. Just might return for a shake next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. oreo cookie and cream shake
Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. food for thought
Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. they a lil pricey

uJpOHEc-MRrG-LXvh7HXJw.text: Come on it's fatburger, it's not gourmet or anything, but there is something satisfying about eating here. Then again I'm a sucker for burgers so maybe that's a thing--but either way I like.

hlaypAgqEm1dW3XFOURxIg.text: I can see why people will love this place while drunk, but sober me is reviewing it and I think other burger places do it better.  I'm currently comparing this to In N Out.  I'm from Florida, so we don't have Fatburger or In N Out, which is why I had to get both on my trip here (I'll try Shake Shack tomorrow).  First disclaimer, I love In N Out, so this would have had to be pretty darn good to beat that.  Unfortunately, it did not live up and it even somewhat disappointed.  First the good, the burger meat is solid.  I got the turkey burger, sans bun, with cheese, and it was delicious.  The shake is also pretty good.  It had a huge heaping of whipped cream on the top that I enjoyed.  The bad, the price is insane.  I got a turkey burger, chili cheese fries, and a milkshake.  Total was $20.  At In N Out, that same meal is $10.  I don't know if it is more expensive, since I'm in vegas, but holy cow.  Also, I was not impressed with the fries.  They were definitely not worth the calories.  I got the skinny fries and ended up throwing them out.  With In N Out I'm scrapping the bottom of everything to get the last remnants of cheese.  This cheese was just meh.  So overall, I wouldn't suggest wasting your calories or your money on this place.  But, then again, when you're drunk this place is probably heaven.

1BxGx2LEPaKqE7Qw1ZWRyA.text: One of my favorite guilty pleasure spots in Vegas. It's one of those places you truly love after you've had a few (dozen) drinks.  Honestly it's a typical burger place but the burger and fries are A+. In my opinion they are better than in-and- out burger and I know people would kill me for saying that.  The portions are huge. And unfortunately the service is slow. What do you expect though?  They offer skinny fries and fat fries. Always fat fries- always and I have to add cheese, bacon and egg to my burger. Oh yeah, and a Diet Coke because I'm watching what I'm eating. ;)  The best part about this place is that it's open 24/7 so you can get your fat on any time you want!

UPtC9Jri5K-2-pE8fUSkAg.text: Jorge at the bar is awesome. Great service, great drinks. Stop by!! We we're checking out the Blvd. Food court and this place had sweet drink specials!

r9qQGSJ0H8Z4qif5Wr8G5w.text: So the funniest thing happened.  We showed up at Fatburger at 9 in the morning on the day we were flying out. We both tweeted "burgers for breakfast!" Hooray! We got an order of fries, a 1/3 pound burger, and a veggie burger. I bit into my veggie burger and the first thing I said was "this is delicious, it tastes like a Big Mac!" Hooray again!  We get home and I start adding the places we visited to my Yelp bookmarks. What's this I notice? Oh, I already wrote a review for Fatburger! What does it say? Burgers for breakfast and it tastes like a Big Mac.  Whoa. O_o  What else can I say? Almost an exact repeat of last year, the food is great, I loved the shoestring fries and the burgers were perfect! This is definitely worth checking out if you wan a fast food burger without the fast food stigma and grossness.

NSRD78CZw0pKZeuX4G74XA.text: Nothing compared to Los Angeles or Santa Barbra's locations.  Had a friend with me who lives in Vegas an mentioned as should have sent to the ShAke shack.  Our hamburgers were dry, no flavor or seasoning was used.  Ordered chili cheese frys also an they sucked.  Many drunk people in there so I'm sure they thought it was good :) the soda fountains Coke was watered down maybe the bib for the syrup was empty.  Flew from Hawaii an was excited to try this place out yet I was disappointed.

W3EItZmorq9lk8FU0837nA.text: My friend and I had practically zero sleep and decided to grab breakfast. Since I was visiting the area, I got to choose, and I chose Fatburger. This place is SO ghetto, which is funny as all hell since it's next door to the MGM Grand. In classic Vegas style, this location has a nifty neon sign, and is open 24 hours.  When we walked in, I couldn't help but snap shots of the interior. A gaggle of transvestites were carrying on and one noticed me, thinking I was trying to photograph them. I assured her/him I was really taking photos of the establishment.  I shared a turkey burger ($5) with my friend which wasn't bad, to start. I took a bite, chewed thoughtfully, took a few notes, then proceeded to douse mine in Tabasco. It's no In-N-Out, but it'll feed you. (I heard that I should get one of their specials, and top it off with a fried egg... next time!)

photos.caption: Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unwrapped turkey burger, split
Photo of Fatburger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger, split

zRTJwb0c0R_OpIIl26Nl3Q.text: I did not try the burgers. I only had their oreo shake and it was delicious! If you are looking for something sweet late at night, do not hesitate and go to fat burger for a shake.

8M6xalhsxalWVokoRyaVVQ.text: The location of this location is awesome and I love that they are 24hr and they even have a bar! But the food wasn't as great as I thought it was going to be.  I was definitely disappointed and what really got me upset was the fact that I paid $20 for a cheese burger with fries and a drink. I don't know about you but that's too expensive and the food wasn't even great.

nHZVKQJVN6qmeqO5wwDTPw.text: Talk about some great drunken munchies after a night out on the strip. This place cranks out burgers in minutes and there really good. There not In-and-Out good but still really good. The place does get crowded and packed and you also have to deal with alot of drunken people but overall not a bad place to go.

PM7CjPYEwfYi4nVAwkQOXA.text: Decided to grab some eats at this local Vegas establishment at about 1am after watching a kick ass show. I grabbed the chili cheese fries and an a medium fatburger (with extra bacon and cheese). I liked that they didn't scrimp on the delicious,tasty chili on the fries and as for the burger, well, it was full of flavour, fresh, hot and really quite a great bite.   A decent meal and a yummy conclusion to a hectic Friday night.

X_QX6pGBzf7TnzBIaVmOAw.text: Awesome little spot on the strip! 5 of my friends held up here to watch the Super Bowl they had the game on and weren't mad that we sat there for 4 hours with a pretty low tab we had been hung over from a heavy night of drinking. Bar tenders were awesome and super friendly the staff was awesome as well! The male bar tender took care of us and he knew we were hurting, took his time and didn't push food or drinks.   Once we warmed up and got some water in our systems we had an awesome time chicken strips were amazing and the fries were light and crispy!

xhjfSJlBRepX-rSKT4x-OQ.text: This place was okay. Never been to a Fatburger before, but we were looking for a quick, cheap dinner our first night in Vegas and this was right by the hotel.  Food is basic, simple (burgers, fries, milkshakes or cocktails) and did the trick. Service was okay. Waitresses in skimpy outfits that looked kinda bored (can't blame them, 7:30pm on a Thursday) but they were at least friendly. Seating outside was the highlight; people watching was the best--right on the strip!

z_4PEMGYQZBjgb4x2FjGvQ.text: We had a groupon for two menu items and a pitcher of margaritas. We went for lunch, sat at the bar and had a great time. Our bartender was nice and fast. The drinks were great and really, how could you go wrong with burgers?  We made a memory we won't soon forget. Sitting on the strip, a nice sunny day, with a margarita and new friends. Doesn't get better than that, especially when you are coming from snowy subartic Chicago.

T20LPi1CLwv1gQR1tJoKLA.text: The best late night stop on Vegas strip.  Burgers are amazing.  Make sure you add the bacon and egg. The addition of the outdoor bar and seating area makes it the perfect place to people watch on a hot summer night.  Waitresses are super friendly and cute.

i1TXCaUST2u8z6yHs02aWA.text: A friend of ours said we HAD to visit Fat burger's when we were in Vegas. He was completely right! Fat burger did not disappoint. The burger was delicious! The dressings they put on the burgers are unique and the sandwich was mouthwatering.

RHqg0cHjQjk73XKDxTjoWw.text: I ordered the smallest turkey burger on the menu add bacon and a fried egg, heavenly. I  couldn't finish my order of onion rings and was totally full.  The server was very friendly and explained the menu very thoroughly to first time customers. They give Smash Burgers a run for their money. The only negative would be the slightly high price.

3pRyK7ms_RBoCfJnJyi6zQ.text: Fat burger makes a big fresh hamburger that is pretty good. Kind of like steak n shake on roids type place. 1. Portillo's.    2. Five Guys 3. Fat burger 4. Smashburger 5. Steak n' Shake

U5WuL56pz69T0dTucQWJ_w.text: Pros  - Open super late - Friendly cashier offered me a complimentary taste/small serving of the "famous frozen custard" - Good, flavorful burgers (especially when you get them hot off the grill...see below)   Cons - Long, unnecessary wait was very frustrating!  I waited patiently for my burger to find out that it had been ready for 15+  minutes and the server had the wrong number for some reason. She was standing right next to me, and I even asked her if it was my order a few times. Lame! Would have been great if she offered to make a hot, fresh one.   It was nice to try the custard, but I didn't think it was extraordinary...who considers it famous anyway?

gwvg_aPxWY37PX1EtDhFQw.text: We're die hard Fatburger fans and stop in every time we're in Las Vegas.  Tonight we stopped in and found that the place has been completely renovated - no issue with that, it looks a lot better.   The only thing that was not better was the food!  The decline in quality was not what we expected but neither was the sharp increase in prices!  $30 bucks for 2 burgers and fries is too much to pay for a strip mall burgers.   We won't be back anytime soon.

VbSs0IeESRthJr_Q0r9B7w.text: The burgers here were really good.  Grilled and with crisp edges.  I would most certainly eat here again.  The place is a little rough around the edges but a good place for a burger and fries and to avoid the expensive places in the hotels.

5g9sUAj9elACjuAZVJ6H9g.text: If you mention you're a local and show your ID, they'll give you a 10% discount.  The prices here are a bit higher than normal.  The food is to be expected.  The staff was very nice.    If you dine outside by the bar, the service staff will take your order there for you.  If you dine inside, you'll have to place your order at the window.  They played old school hip hop the night we went, so the throwback music was fun.

QtJr5RUtiA1FBZpsLwyqyQ.text: This place is amazing. The bartender Joe was incredibly helpful with finding me a great beer. He was very knowledgeable and super fun. I definitely recommend anybody, locals or tourists to come dine t fat burger

_HCNQbPy-v2RhpmfzgThwA.text: The most awesome thing about this Fatburger is that they open 24 hours. We got hungry once at 2:30 am and decided to walk there. My 1st experience there's funny. When I walked in, I was greeted with non-stop rap songs. Also, there are so many ghetto people in there too, all shady looking. I thought we're gonna get robbed, shot or something lol.  The burger itself is really greasy. You can order the size you want (from S - XXXL) and can pay extra for additional cool toppings, such as chilli and fried egg (I'd recommend these). The burger comes with mustard, mayo, relish, shredded lettuce & tomatoes. The burger as a whole's pretty good. I like the toppings that they put in there.  Conclusion: The burger's pretty good. About the same with 5 guys, but definitely can't beat In-N-Out.

QmHAJQCmY_gUUEkyYK9-Sg.text: BEWARE. THEY USE LEAN MEAT!! haha, Just sayin', the burger was kinda dry. but definately a pretty good burger and fries. got 2 burgers, and shared a thing of fries. total bill $30. Not bad, wouldn't go back though

K1SzWJNZXeLmRzn5oTWKBQ.text: Came in at 4am. My friends were pretty drunk but they handled us perfectly. Shay went above and beyond which is really so unnecessary at a fast food place in Vegas at that hour. The manager that was ringing  (I didn't see his name tag) was also super accommodating. I don't really eat fast food but they made my experience great. Really thank you guys! You were amazing!

P2FCu7RV7eJ8OxkmGWy5MQ.text: Fatburger is all hype. They're just overpriced burgers. I'm not saying it's not good, but it's nothing special. Cheese does not automatically come on the burgers, you have to pay an extra dollar for it. There are other add ons you can get for an extra charge as well. It also comes a la carte so sides are separate. Two burgers (one large and one medium) and a side of fries came out to almost 30 dollars.

kTlu_DudGrPZlRCRApwyig.text: Way overpriced from what it use to be. Food was just okay and fries where cold. Had to have the fries made fresh.

_ziT-Q_PqCMrPiNEBPcu3g.text: Michael the cashier and George the server need to be fired! Michael does not know what the term "make it a meal means.  After I told George the server, that I was missing an order of fries he said oh well thats not my problem talk to the cashier!!! OMG I wanted to kill him at this point.  What type of service is this???

AQKmHZacfUC-QZPaT--xug.text: Last minute search for something to eat. It was late, it was cold and Fatburger is a few minutes from our hotel so this is where my husband ended up.  He brought back burgers, fries & a milkshake for the teenager.  My burger was surprisingly good.  I loved all the little bits of onion throughout my burger and it was tasty.  I was told that they were greasy burgers but I didn't think so at all.  And the fries are yum too.

6A2suew6cMs8iZLgiCh4nA.text: - Clean restaurant on the strip in Las Vegas. Ton of foot traffic and bright lights of Las Vegas in view while you eat. Atmosphere isn't a problem, the actual food however is another thing all together. The bacon burger I had didn't have greasy goodness, the oreo shake I had lacked any real taste. In this age of "healthy organic foods" there's no sin in eating real food in Sin City. When you eat food that isn't great for you however and it doesn't even taste good....well that is a deadly sin!

ed6MHHd-DxVA07Gi30B-Lg.text: My friend heard great reviews of this place, so we decided to eat here for lunch while on vacation. I ordered the medium cheeseburger and onion rings. My meal came up to $16 (I had lemonade too). The burger was underwhelming. The burger was tart and pickley. The onion rings were plain and nothing special. I had buyers remorse throughout the entire meal. Just get a double double from In & Out. Pretty sure I'm not coming here again. (There is a bar outside, so maybe if you drink enough the food will taste better?)

YxdO45k6yCSKaR34zG_SCA.text: Fatburger--or more specifically, Kingburger--I am coming back to Vegas to eat you! And I am adding bacon and cheese and homemade onion rings to your 8 ounces of juicy, fat deliciousness too. Nine years it's been since I had the biggest, juiciest fast food burger ever. And just for the record: Fatburger kicks In-N-Out to the curb!

svgJpUe5W9y1rmoSh7H1TA.text: Great burgers, I wouldn't say they're over the top best, but they sure are good.

fu2SxCa0p8MkpKiT2Bj6vQ.text: We were in Las Vegas last week and went to Fatburger 2 separate times.  On the 1st visit we had a burger and fries. While both were good, they really were nothing special. If anything the meat was slightly on the dry side. On our last morning is Vegas we went for breakfast. I had eggs potatoes and toast.  The eggs were very much undercooked, barely enough to not turn them back in. Potatoes were very good.

gCd_CFgBH3IvKG3qjRYsFg.text: I hope there was something less than a 1 star rating. WASTE OF MONEY, STAY OUT OF IT......!!!! we spend $70 dlls. on hamburgers (5 people), $70 dollars for food for 5 is nothing, specially at Vegas, but when you just throw your money down the drain, to me that's a fortune, even the $1 cheap Mcdonald's burgers are way better that those served at this location, DRY and COLD buns, flavor-less patty's, COLD onion rings, lousy service, orders taken wrongly after a 40 mins waiting, no soda refills offered, it took another 20 mins.at the end just to get the tab............. MY TIP:............$ .000000 of a penny the place wasn't even full, so that is not an excuse, it is on a great location on the strip, tables and bar to eat ouside but not even that saves the experience. AGAIN, STAY OUT OF IT.......................

uoAunMyxvkzZ4vMmiQHoFQ.text: Definitely a delicious stop on the way back to our hotel from gambling at MGM. Nice greasy burger and onion rings. Perfect when you're drunk. Stop here if you're in the area. It's nice that they have cooling sprinkler things too

3RgNs6pEMvFXU6X-rENctw.text: If I could have given this place less than one star, I would have.  This place is a total disaster.     Our sad tale begins by being greeted by our waitress, a woman that would make a skank look classy.  She took our order for a couple of beers and for our food.  She returned 10 minutes later with our beers, but that was the last that we saw her.  I guess that on some level, I should have been thankful. Any prolonged contact with our server would have ensured an incurable case of syphillis at the very least.   Did I mention that she was dirty??  After 45 minutes of waiting for the food, our beers long dry, we sought out our server to find out what was going on.  Upon finding her, the skank threw us a lot shade, and even had the nerve to state that it was my fault that we had been waiting so long.  Yup...skanks truly are dumb.   At that point, I decided to minimize my contact with my server without having the benefit of a hazmat suit and found the manger.  Of course, he offered to get us our food right away, but we were pushing up on an hour at this point.  While this was all going on, my herpes scarred waitress was screaming that she had done nothing wrong....except be a waste of human life that is.  The manager saw what was going on and offered to comp us our entire check.  That being said, we thanked him, but told him tht he could keep his crap food because my guest and I just wanted to get the hell out of there.  This dump really needs to get a handle on its staff.  Avoid this one at all costs people.    You've been warned!!

FgGCp9Ci7Y5o1Y663YFeqg.text: This review is centered specifically on Fatburger's outside "yard long" alcoholic beverages. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY, there is next to NO ALCOHOL IN THEM. For $30 bucks you're supposed to get around 6 shots or alcohol in a 50oz cup, but all you'll get is a sugar headache. My wife and I got one each to start out out Vegas Strip night, but after finishing my entire drink I could hardly feel anything. SCAM ALERT!

EmGCWtYKL3GvViFXWPVoUw.text: Really just made me wish we had an auto vehicle and could sputter to an off-the-strip In-N-Out.  Watching football on a breezy patio was a nice alternative to the smoke-infested sports books, though.

cxxqiPa3acPOUSvo9DOBKw.text: The first thing that you notice is that the food is overpriced. Then you taste it. The worst burger I have ever had. And that comes from a lifelong experience with burgers. I would never, ever give it a second chance. It was greasy, fatty, flavorless, and metallic. The fries mirrored the burger.  An awful dining experience. This place is perched on the lowest rung. Lower than the corner greasy spoon. Steer far, far away from Fatburger. You have many other choices for burgers and fries, and they are all better than this place.

Sj2dNnhrQhA17UOnAUimcw.text: Excellent burgers, love the fries, but the deal maker for me? The shakes. OMG Amazing. Service was fast, food was good. Tables could have been wiped down more often, but all in all, so worth the stop. Open 24 hours. Nice casual place to stop in and grab a bite on the strip.

Sf544J2PlgshDPDQCs9IBA.text: Overpriced for burger and service was terrible.  Waitress was rude and not friendly at all.  No kids menu.  1/3 lbs is way to big for a child.  Not recommended for families.

07Sbeetfpndp_fFUHYPL1w.text: Wow. We opted to go to Fatburger on a Monday night INSTEAD of going to a strip club. This has to say something about the draw of their 'cuisine' here. Perhaps it's sprinkled with a ghetto-fabulous dust that has the same addictive qualities as coke (I believe this dust is sodium and lard-based).  For the two of us, we ordered about 60 dollars worth of food. The food isn't good, but if you feel the craving of a pregnant lady itching inside you for fried and greasy food that will probably dissipate the moment holy water ever touched it, this is your place.   We went around 3am and it was still open, so yay for the hours.  I got some oreo shake concoction, and it was so thick that when I turned my cup upside-down, the shake was still in place; not one drop leaked out of the cup.  We ordered the chicken burger, 2 other burgers with assorted toppings, hotdog, chili fries, onion rings, beer (from outside), and the shake. After all, we had a checklist for things to do while in Vegas, and our list was basically a list of the 7 sins. Gluttony, check.  It was all very wrong, but felt so right.

zNjCRqfeSscbcelDu5Z-yw.text: I took the advise of a couple coming out of McDonalds that we should check out Fatburger that was right next door. This was the biggest mistake of my trip. It took no less than 30 minutes to get our food (two cheeseburgers and two fries) and it was completely burnt. The place looks like it belongs in a back alley with the floor and tables being torn up, but trust me, this doesn't have any of that hole-in-the-wall charm, its just sick.

TEO02r_XRgCowko1M-m58A.text: Ok, so I may have been in an altered state of conciousness when I hit up Fatburger. Not so much from the alcohol per se, but from the pain in my feet from walking about 34 miles from the bar at another hotel back to mgm. In heels. All I know is that fatburger was like the oasis in the desert. Onion rings and a ginormous milk shake was perfection.

lbPO1z9QgKWFaUkjyNMpAw.text: I love Fatburger but Be carefull at the Las vegas Strip Fat Burger keep you reciept the employees are scamming customers. I was charged an extra $2.00 to my credit card without my authurization. My friend was charged $9.00 more to her credit card. At the the end of the day I bet the make some serious cash by all the people they rip off. Again keep your recipt. I hope they do something about this but I doubt it....

C8ZyynppHA1AHek7SUy_nw.text: This location is a disgrace to Fatburger. Received absolute sh*t service with an attitude from Corrine. Then, after she screwed up my order, she argued with me that it was my fault (I'd be the first to admit if it was my fault, but it wasn't in this case). Everyone makes mistakes, but damn... Live up to them. Then they actually made me run a separate credit card transaction to add the slice of cheese they failed to add. Honestly everyone working at this location seemed to high or drunk to be able to concentrate on anything specific. I know complaining about a messed up order sounds petty - and I know how petty it is, but it was the being berated by the cashier that blew me away. When you're wrong, just say "sorry" and put the damn cheese on - don't argue with the customer. Won't be back to this location. Hit up one of the station casino locations instead. At the Red Rock Station location they are always friendly and the location is always clean and they don't all seem like they would set measurement records on a drug test.

55f1sqDGbKQZzNbLZ2rBiQ.text: Terrible food.  Terrible service.  Very dirty establishment.  I don't know what all the hype is about over this place.  I believe its because of all the celebrities that endorse it.  But this place had a flat, dried out meat patty, much like one you would get at a Dennys.  Their choice of beef cut produced a mild flavored, non-juicy patty.  They burned my wife's burger, and when she tried to exchange it, they gave her attitude by trying to tell her it was just the cheese.  But they did end up making her another one.  "In n Out" or "5 Guys" are both much better choices.  Never again!

HeliWFXKpPinTyvGU9upcQ.text: Fat Burger is good, but not better than In N Out. I like the fact that they're open 24 hours. The burgers here are not as great as other burger joints I have been to. The prices were pretty high too. If I'm in Las Vegas and it is late at night and I'm craving a hamburger I'll go here. I had the triple king which was humongous, i couldn't even finish it!  =O

_sbBBssQIortsU0EpQ6_Lw.text: Burger with tasty smoky grilled flavor and choice of toppings. May order different weight patties. Really enjoyed the crispy outside, soft inside "fat" fries (similar to steak fries). The"skinny" fries tasted like McD's if you prefer. The lemonade was made from real lemons with pulp in the tart and sweet drink. Only negative was the price (reason for 4 rather than 5 stars), but this Fatburger is on the Las Vegas Strip, so bet less expensive at other sites.

GXMx_sZjoOkdvGZ5PCbCng.text: The wait can be a little lengthy once the throngs of tourists all get a mean buzz working, but every time I've been in here, the food has been some real good stuff. The burger is fine in its own right, and anywhere you can add egg to a burger wins points in my book. The staff is pretty cool too, they always seem to be having a good time despite wage slavery in servitude of a bunch of cheap drunks. One of the older Mexican dudes that brings people their food challenged us gringos to a pepper-eating contest (he won). It was fun at the time, but later on, burning sensations led me to realize I should not have eaten such a large quantity of spicy peppers. Please learn from my mistake if he challenges you too.

QMW1U6xj1XM0IE1zDtQ5Kg.text: This is the place to go for a VERY indulgent and greasy burger with egg and cheese. (groan) I can STILL feel it. :P But it's totally wicked after a good nite of clubbing and drinking. fer sure!!

MyarcEeI1Y-Dt8VlZILQJg.text: I went to Fatburger twice on my recent trip to Las Vegas. I was seriously tired of the buffets and loved the burger here. Got a king burger, with onion rings and a banana shake (which was to die for).  I will be back here on my next visit to this location on the strip.

vSXBD2uopH6tTVKcVNkfvw.text: This place is awesome! Loved the MEDIUM size burger with the fries. Believe me the medium is big enough... My friend got the XL burger & she was waaaay overwhelmed it was waaaay too big. The medium is perfect, about the size of a whopper junior at BK. it was really good. And the lemonade is bomb. Cool motown music blasting 4:00am on the strip, this is a cool place:)

JwD84LQe9JRlvYjhuU32WA.text: Amazing customer service!!!! The people are so nice!!! And the burgers are a great way to fill your tummy!

2SBCzXdZxRQwVNLGfzQsnA.text: DON'T EAT HERE IF AN OLD INDIAN/MAYBE LATINA WOMAN IS WORKING THE CONDIMENTS!!!!  I was making my second trip here during my Vegas vacation on a slow, Sunday afternoon. When I got my order it was wrong. No big deal, just needed a bun swap (I HATE MAYO!!!) and different condiments. I brought the burger back and asked to get a new top bun. THE LADY PROCEEDED TO WIPE OFF THE TOP OF THE BUN WITH A WET, DIRTY, RAG, AND WAS READY TO GIVE IT BACK TO ME! Who does that???   When I confronted the lady and her manager, she flat out denied what I just saw in front of my face. On top of that she denied taking our receipt too! What a shame! On top of all of this, the f*%$ head manger gave me tons of attitude after I demanded a refund. I had so much love for this place before, but what did I ever expect from a fast food place on the Strip? Good luck eating here. I hope to revive my love affair for the Fatburger establishment one day, but not on Las Vegas Blvd.

hposDHEv7Pt-F3UBqFNsxw.text: This place is good.  My friends and I went there a lot during our trip to Vegas.  They're 24 hours and taste a lot better than In N Out.  I wish they had a Fatburger near me. =(

fvg_2jYIoeg-xlrCwGILBQ.text: Great break from everything big on the strip.  Pretty interesting crowd but staff seemed to be on the ball.

zDuWaP_wYwgtmpP0Kclz9g.text: open 24 hours and on the strip....so if you need to get your burger fix on, then go here.    But if you can get your eat on during regular hours, then go to in n out on dean martin via a cab.   Had the steak cut fries and burger combo, next time i'll have to try the skinny fries or the onion rings.    Nothing special, but if you have to get your eat on at night then a decent option.

kIuCmDFSjHcMzpAWEOeHqg.text: Some good grease when your wacked!!!  Always good and late nite is the best time to chow!!!

cnnAyCeB83FirpOF1xOR7g.text: I first went to this Fatburger a few months ago when I was in Vegas for a friend's bachelor party.  The burgers are AWESOME, especially for a fast food joint.  I used to think In-And-Out was the hidden fast food burger gem on the west coast...but Fatburger passed them up!   Fast forward to last week.  I was back in Vegas with a few friends and one of my friends had a Triple King Burger (three 1/2 pound patties).  If you finish this monstrosity, they give you a free t-shirt and take your picture to put up on the wall.  He finished it and got his picture taken.  They were out of t-shirts though.   A few nights later, we went back.  I ordered a QUAD King Burger (trip-King + 1 extra patty) to one-up my friend.  After consuming TWO POUNDS of delicious hamburger, I instantly regretted my decision.  The burger was awesome (as usual), but I was disgustingly full.  They were still out of t-shirts, and their camera was broken too, but I didn't care.  Right after we left, one of the cooks came outside after me to shake my hand.  I LOVE FATBURGER!

MbcgufUoTwZ6dX9CptBvSw.text: i really liked fatburger for burgers. they were good burgers but i'm only giving it 3 stars. i prefer five guys and give them 4 stars so i have to give them 1 less. its a burger so nothing too special but still a good burger. nothing else really to say about it

labx4QdjRED_Jj9QY_cBlA.text: not a big fan of burgers and i thought the burgers tasted like mcDonalds burgers. but i was hungry. it's a place seems like everyone after clubs and bars go to.
